intro: Padbruggea, commonly known as the red hot poker, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its striking, spiky flower clusters that range in color from red to orange and yellow. The plants are native to southern Africa and are often cultivated for their ornamental value. They typically grow in well-drained soils and prefer full sun exposure. Padbruggea species are known for their drought tolerance and ability to thrive in arid environments.
